{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3553052,"name":"Layton","username":"LaytonK737","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/aca169/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-10T18:14:49.937Z","cooked":"

So I am running into a issue with running out of buttons for our operator to use so is it possible to make commands activate under one button what I mean by this is like we hit button a and then our wrist would flip to the position then it would make our elevator go up

I linked our GitHub below

github.com

GitHub - discoduck39/code8564

Contribute to discoduck39/code8564 development by creating an account on GitHub.

Yes, you want command compositions

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Command Compositions

Individual commands are capable of accomplishing a large variety of robot tasks, but the simple three-state format can quickly become cumbersome when more advanced functionality requiring extended ...

Another option is using another button as a shift key. Our face buttons (abxy) all have two functions, controlling the climber and giving us manual control of our intake motors (so we can reverse a failed intake). But when we hold the right trigger and press a button, the robot automatically orients to face the direction corresponding to the pressed button. This can be done with the negate function, to enable only one set of commands to run at a time (like we did with our climb/fall commands here: Mechanical-Pumas-2025/src/main/java/frc/robot/RobotContainer.java at main · cjmasini/Mechanical-Pumas-2025 · GitHub)
